title: if you feed the enemy 5 kills in the first 8 mins
body: dont spam ping your jger to fucking gank so they can feed with you, sometimes you have to understand when your lane is too far gone to save and it is NOT my job to try and win it for you, stay under tower and farm while i help other lanes and dont be a toxic baby expecting me to try and 2v1 the 7/0 {{champion:420}} with you and spam pinging me missing everytime you shove up and die, cuz believe me im just gonna ping your death timer right back at ya

replies.body: On the flip side, one or two kills don't decide a lane. If someone falls behind and asks for a gank while their laner is barely ahead, junglers need to go to that lane and helo them out. Ignoring a lane that isn't far behind but is still losing is a recipe for tilt and a fed enemy
it really depends on champions at that point because in some matchups 2 kills early can make a lane completely over
I'm talking about in general. Of course someone like Illaoi or Darius will shit on you if they get 2 kills, but most other champs wonty
ya i play xin so theres few champs that can 2v1 depending on the laner
Xin the free lp boy
In this season, basically anyone can get two kills and the game is over. Too much damage

> [{quoted}](name=Atmosphere,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AZ04N5Kt,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-11-05T17:12:19.384+0000)
>
> On the flip side, one or two kills don't decide a lane. If someone falls behind and asks for a gank while their laner is barely ahead, junglers need to go to that lane and helo them out. Ignoring a lane that isn't far behind but is still losing is a recipe for tilt and a fed enemy

The problem is when all 3 lanes fall behind at the same time and they all ping spam the jungler to gank at once. Well now you have to pick a lane, making one happy and 2 mad "OMGZ WHY YOU NOT GANK FOR ME?". Ahh the life of a jungler, there really are Kobeyashi Maru scenarios.

That doesn't happen as often as one lane falling behind though. In my experience, most junglers will ignore a losing lane, camp one lane, then act surprised when the lane they ignored is super weak and their opponent is fed

The scenario you mentioned is not what his post is saying. And on the "flipside" a JGL doesn't NEED to do what the laners may think they NEED to do. have faith your JGL sees the win condition, and is not bias to any certain lane like every laner making the counter argument is. Since there lane in the first 15 mins is more important to them then anyone elses. #JUSTSAYIN

"I know you think that a jungler's job is to exert map pressure, get leads around the map, and help lanes falling behind, but I'm #JUSTSAYIN that a jungler doesn't NEED to do anything and you have to HAVE FAITH." I have no faith in solo queue jungle players lol. You sound ridiculous
Sounds like you should just go play another game. lol
Every game is really back and forth

It depends on how those kills played out. If my laner dies in the first 5 minutes and hasn't even taken his opponent below 80% hp, I'm not going to help. If my laner is 0/3 but the fights are still really close, that's worth helping

I seriously disagree, if toplane juggernaut/fighter or a strong botlane like ....draven/vayne + leo/thresh gets ahead then they are ridiculously difficult to stop.


Any of the top 10 toplaners can easily 1v2 when ahead if the enemy "helper" isnt fed.

Like i´ve had so many cases trying to gank botlane, get hit by a thresh hook or another slightly long CC and i seriously die before its over or just after......i might not be a  sharp or bright knife compared to others but even i know that if it happens more than 5 times in different games with only minor variations in picks and setup then its no coincidence, rather its the norm that one has to play around.


I recently had a ryze toplane into a vikor, Ryze starts feeding his ass of early and actually dies 4 times before i even hit 6 as a jungler, to experiment i tested walking near viktor without actually intending to gank him.

I lost 70% health in a heartbeat, without his ult.

I immediately gave up on that thing and went to other lanes........as a jungler the importance of knowing a "dead" lane is almost as big as knowing a good starting route.
oh that lane is done, no  one can save it lol.

kinda goes for bot lane to, ive no joke had bot lanes feed the enemy adc 5 whole ass kills before 7 mins like if your enemy laner has a full stormrazor at 10 and is ahead of you by 2 levels i dont know what you expect me to do about it because thats just giving them a free triple usually

If I can play a fed {{champion:11}}....
MAYBE, but I guarantee we aren't both getting out alive with that bounty...

I wouldn't expect that laner to stay in their lane and just get ramrodded then. If my Jungler isn't gonna help gank when I've been ganked 4 times and I'm 0/5 against fed whatever, then I'll just give up the lane and go roam. If the top laner takes all the towers and no one reacts then it's no longer my problem. I'm not gonna sit and get smashed for 20 minutes trying to hold towers if my jungler has given up on that side of the map.

> [{quoted}](name=OneMustFall,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AZ04N5Kt,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2018-11-05T22:31:21.759+0000)
>
> I wouldn't expect that laner to stay in their lane and just get ramrodded then. If my Jungler isn't gonna help gank when I've been ganked 4 times and I'm 0/5 against fed whatever, then I'll just give up the lane and go roam. If the top laner takes all the towers and no one reacts then it's no longer my problem. I'm not gonna sit and get smashed for 20 minutes trying to hold towers if my jungler has given up on that side of the map.

if you die to ganks 4 times and you're getting ganked 4 times that's probably because you're overextended/not warding. If you fuck up that badly and can't position/ward there's no reason for the jungler to think you won't throw away the resources put into you. Plus if you know their jungler is hovering around the lane and you're behind you lose the 2v2 as well. The risk is in no way, shape or form anywhere near worth the reward. It's your responsibility to salvage and try to make the most of the lane you fucked up. The jungler isn't your safety net.

> [{quoted}](name=demoted to iron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AZ04N5Kt,comment-id=000e0001,timestamp=2018-11-05T23:16:17.665+0000)
>
> if you die to ganks 4 times and you're getting ganked 4 times that's probably because you're overextended/not warding. If you fuck up that badly and can't position/ward there's no reason for the jungler to think you won't throw away the resources put into you. Plus if you know their jungler is hovering around the lane and you're behind you lose the 2v2 as well. The risk is in no way, shape or form anywhere near worth the reward. It's your responsibility to salvage and try to make the most of the lane you fucked up. The jungler isn't your safety net.

Perhaps that logic would work if you had the ability to ward constantly but you don't. Wards have cooldowns. Not only that but good Junglers will clear your wards. And then you're talking about overextending. Well see here's the thing, going past the river would be overextending. However literally everyone goes past the river to farm/bully the laner/etc. Otherwise Junglers wouldn't be able to gank period. So that's a terrible argument. 

Honestly if the Jungler has that kind of shitty attitude where they're not concerned about the tower or making sure they're warding/doing their part to keep the lane from being bullied, why should the top laner care? That tower is gonna fall anyway, might as well see what they can at other parts of the map.

But to be real, if my jungler hasn't ganked once and I've been ganked 4 times, whether or not I die I know that game's gonna be a loss cause my jungler blows ass.

> [{quoted}](name=OneMustFall,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AZ04N5Kt,comment-id=000e00010000,timestamp=2018-11-06T02:29:00.610+0000)
>
> Perhaps that logic would work if you had the ability to ward constantly but you don't. Wards have cooldowns. Not only that but good Junglers will clear your wards. And then you're talking about overextending. Well see here's the thing, going past the river would be overextending. However literally everyone goes past the river to farm/bully the laner/etc. Otherwise Junglers wouldn't be able to gank period. So that's a terrible argument. 
> 
> Honestly if the Jungler has that kind of shitty attitude where they're not concerned about the tower or making sure they're warding/doing their part to keep the lane from being bullied, why should the top laner care? That tower is gonna fall anyway, might as well see what they can at other parts of the map.
> 
> But to be real, if my jungler hasn't ganked once and I've been ganked 4 times, whether or not I die I know that game's gonna be a loss cause my jungler blows ass.

Or just let them push and freeze the wave? Should be easy with any basic knowledge of how to manipulate waves. Buy a control ward and plant it behind you to prevent a dive and go from there. Back off and lose farm instead of feeding and losing farm. You're also talking about "shitty attitude" while stating "why should I care?" You also seem to lack basic knowledge of jungling. Your lane is not the only lane available to gank and the metric to judge junglers off of is not the number of ganks attempted. Time is a key resource when you jungle and if the jungler deems a lane a waste of time to gank, then ganking that lane is, by proxy,  a waste of resources that could've been spent doing something productive. That "shitty attitude" is basic position knowledge.

It is the team's responsibility to defend objectives, it is fine to roam. Refusing to defend towers at all is a different story.
you do realize most high elo players advise to leave the hyper feeding lanes alone when they get to a certain point right?

If you die to ganks 4 times in a row early then you have no one except yourself to blame,  there is nothing capable of saving you at this point and enemy toplane can easily 1v2 so your jungler cant do shit.

Warding when you want to play aggressive, freezing the wave when you dont and paying great amounts of attention towards possible enemy jungle spots are part of the absolute basics of a toplaner, if you cant do these you are thoroughly unqualified to write about the subject at all. 


All the good toplane champs can easily 1v2 when fed,,,,,,its pretty much a requirement for them.


I do not have great jungling skills having only started to play it seriously recently (but periodically before) having mainly played mid,ADC and support until recently but one thing i learnt pretty quickly is that as a jungler if you want o gank a lane that is ahead by anything more than 2 kills and just a tiny bit of EXP then you have to be ridiculously careful or you´ll just die for nothing.

Oh and to mention but i did main toplane for quite some time,  I know exactly how that lane works. 


Enemy Darius/jax/viktor/illaoi/GP/garen/urgot/aatrox/kled 4,0,0? Cant be killed by 2 melee champs who are behind, its impossible, give it up, its good enough if you can get EXP and small amounts of farm at this point and pray your jungler can save the others.



Just look at some of the recently worlds matches, we had like 10+ cases of a 2,0,0 urgot/aatrox winning 1v2 against enemy top+jungle,  i think G2 wunder even did it multiple times. 

No sane jungler will try to gank that sorta lane if even the pros cant do it.
dw, we dont expect someone dying at each gank and in 0/5 in less ten min to use his brain {{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}
When ppl ask why I don't gank a lane that's losing. It's because u fucked up I am not touching that pile of crap

It is far more efficient for junglers to gank winning lanes rather than losing ones. The risk to reward ratio is just far too off to ever bother ganking losing lanes unless you yourself as the jungler is ahead.

Ganking a winning lane almost never fails, gets a decent advantage ( a kill is a kill and denying enemy farm is huge even if you're killing a feeding opponent), and generally don't have to worry about getting counter ganked. No downsides.
Ganking a losing lane means possibly losing 2 v 1 straight up, or getting counter ganked and definitely losing 2 v 2 and pretty much a huge risk of massive downside. Moderate chance of a 1 for 1 trade which is a small plus. In the small case of the best case scenario that the gank does succeed completely with a kill for free, you might have added more gold to your team than ganking another lane would, but chances are that lane is STILL losing and would require more investment to let your laner go even, which means taking another high risk gank.

> [{quoted}](name=KirbyCake,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AZ04N5Kt,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2018-11-05T20:03:05.525+0000)
>
> Ganking a losing lane means possibly losing 2 v 1 straight up, or getting counter ganked and definitely losing 2 v 2 and pretty much a huge risk of massive downside. Moderate chance of a 1 for 1 trade which is a small plus. In the small case of the best case scenario that the gank does succeed completely with a kill for free, you might have added more gold to your team than ganking another lane would, but chances are that lane is STILL losing and would require more investment to let your laner go even, which means taking another high risk gank.

Not to mention if you do succeed in killing the fed enemy, your ally just got a kill/assist and reset how much gold they're worth. Making the enemy get *even more* fed the next few times they kill your ally than they would if you didn't give that lane help in the first place.

> stay under tower and farm

{{champion:84}} : _"Hello there"_

{{champion:80}} :  hi akali, I hear the tower shots are lovely this time of year

the big question, is this the opponent, or an ally?
Even when the laner gets solo killed 2 times he is beyond saving as he is way to much outclassed by the enemy.

> [{quoted}](name=Big ol Nom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AZ04N5Kt,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-11-05T15:11:48.463+0000)
>
> dont spam ping your jger to fucking gank so they can feed with you, sometimes you have to understand when your lane is too far gone to save and it is NOT my job to try and win it for you, stay under tower and farm while i help other lanes and dont be a toxic baby expecting me to try and 2v1 the 7/0 {{champion:420}} with you and spam pinging me missing everytime you shove up and die, cuz believe me im just gonna ping your death timer right back at ya

The easiest thing you can do is mute them and focus elsewhere.
if you feed the enemy 5 kills in 8 minutes you are inting and anything you say will have 2 possible results you are going to get flamed our muted.

Staying under tower doesn't help anymore especially if that idiot is past 0/2 in just the first few minutes.

Just don't speak to him. It will just cause more problems if you respond in kind or aggression.

In match or hours after the match he'll learn to never pull that shit again, remain calm, work on his cs, positioning and being safe.
If it's a top laner struggling to cs but has good sustain or mobility to escape you can always do the singed stragety of just farming behind enemy towers then just flee.

Top lane has it easy when it comes to escaping the enemy top laner and jungler since bot laners don't go there much and most mid laners don't pay attention that there is a fight or a chase going on near top lane.

If you do get caught but minions or jungle monsters are nearby and you have no hope in killing any enemy player then you can just try to suck up as much cs as you can before you die.

I do this stragety If I'm having lane trouble as Nasus, Singed, Trundle, Gnar, Kled, Teemo, Ornn, Riven. This may look like a troll move to alot of people but alot of people will understand that this stragety does help in pushing towards enemy towers, getting your own money, exp and this does bait enemy jungler and enemy top to chase you (sometimes the mid laner). Doing this stunt then gives my allies information on where the enemy jungle,top,mid is and it makes pushing bot lane and getting dragon less stressful.

Also in alot of my top lane matches where I have been chased, the enemy trio that is Jungle, Top and sometimes mid. They get weakened from my attacks, jungle monsters who have been triggered nearby and chasing me which means alot of their spells and summoner spells will go on CD and will leave them exposed to get shutdown so my ally mid and ally jungler can $_$ cash in that thicc big boi money after I'm dead or just escaped with 1 hp.

I encourage you brave top lane players to give this a try, improve on your routes, save that flash for the right moment if you can.... and yes... that includes you, Sion mains/try hards to.
honestly unless shes feeding or you have a ton of cc dont gank illaoi once shes 6

lol, I remember when Illaoi was new, I tried the tank build strategy instead of the "fun" AD build, well, it was mid or late game, 4 people jumped on me alone and I killed two of them before my team got there and I died XD
exactly. it's to the point where i play up because i want to get ganked

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 
AMEN
Question inting sion, 4 towers down by 15 mins

Sometimes, what's needed isn't a kill, but simple pressure to help the laner.

E.G if the jungler shows mid, it makes the fed enemy mid a bit more reluctant to dive, therefore helping your mid.

Except there is a pair of  things called time efficiency and experience, jungler cant afford to babysit a lane for the sake of "pressure" because of them

Riot has nerfed EXP so you need to spent every minute farming, ganking or counterjungling, just walking around idly without actually getting anything done means you lose.

Enemy strong and feels like they can dive? They will do it the moment they are certain you cant intervene in time at any rate, and if they think you are around they will either ward or go with their own jungler to wipe you out and then you actually lose all map control as enemy jungle will be fed.

As a jungler its almost game over when enemy jungle gets a ahead so anything and everything must be spent to avoid that.

A lane goes to hell? If the jungler stays healthy and gets the other 2 lanes to win you´ll stand a great chance at winning anyway.


Thus, the risk/reward ratio for even trying to help a single lane falling apart is far, far too unbalanced. 


I recently had a ryze toplane vs a viktor, ryze died like 2-3 times before 10 minutes and viktor hit lvl 7 when i and everyone else, ryze included, was still 5.

I on trial walked by the viktor and instantly lost 70% health.......you think i dare try to gank this one for real? 

I told the Ryze that he was own his own then i went on to win the other lanes, and the game.

I never said baby sit, and never said to actually gank.

Literally all you have to do is walk into lane, and pop back out. Doing so provides psychological pressure on the opposing laner, which makes them more wary, and therefore less likely to aggressively push their advantage in lane. This helps out your laner by allowing them some breathing room, even without you actually doing anything

And this is what i say is wrong, why in the world should the enemy laner be even slightly scared if they can easily kill you even if you try to help your teammate? Double kill you both even?

The issue with a feeding lane is that it doesnt stop in 8 out 10 cases, die once, die thrice and then its not possible to salvage anymore,
exception being if the jungler themselves are fed, but thats a bad thing to bet on.


So if the laner dies too quickly between the first and second death, falls behind greatly in farm and a bit in EXP then ganking is no longer doable and most people know it......sure if you shut them down after the first kill and prevent a true lead from happening its great but many people who are good enough to get that lead in the first place wont throw it away.
I have the opposite problem. I tell them not to gank but they come and give enemy top double buffs
The Jungler isnt there to play your lane for you, thats the major thing people need to get. But when people start losing they automatically expect you to do so
well, sometimes they just expect the jungler to show up when the opponent is over-extended, but every jungler is different, as is every player
What about ten death in 10 minutes. *cough* hashinshin *cough*

I just realized that Illaoi is champion number 420 on boards. When illaoi gets fed, it's almost like a 420 blaze it meme.

On topic though: Yikes.
Only jungle mains can relate.
Not always true. For Illaoi, yes it's true. But if it's a...let's say, Fiora, aslong as you don't fuck up her ult minigame (stand next to a wall so she can't hit the last vital), you can kill her.
Honestly, that game is over unless your entire team carefully shuts down the fed champion before they can roam and snowball other lanes.
